channel.title: Hacker News - English
channel.description: Hacker News articles summarized and translated to English

item.title: AI's Dial-Up Era
item.description:
Some believe digital commerce will overtake physical retail within years. The other claims that AI will create more jobs than it destroys. ”Second, the tech consensus that we will see increased employment actually.

Read more

item.title: Things you can do with diodes
A Friendly Tour of Process Memory on Linux
item.description:
Tiny explainer: /proc /proc is a virtual filesystem the kernel builds in memory. Tiny explainer: page Hardware manages memory in fixed chunks called pages. File mappings mirror file contents.

Read more

item.title: Guideline has been acquired by Gusto
item.description:
Your current 401(k) setup stays exactly the same. Yes, you will continue to have access to all documentation within your dashboard. No, there will be no changes to your investments at this time.

item.title: Linkers: A 20 Part Series (2007)
item.description:
This is because the job which a linker does is uninteresting. An assembler is used to turn this assembly code into an object file. This new program became known as the linker (the source of this name should be obvious).

Read more

item.title: Agent-o-rama: build, trace, evaluate, and monitor LLM agents in Java or Clojure
item.description:
Agent-o-rama fills that gap. In that directory you’ll find equivalent Java and Clojure versions. Concerned with how Wilder's work reflects and influences societal norms.

Read more

item.title: Why engineers can't be rational about programming languages
item.description:
It’s not that I think they should have chosen Go, Go would have been the wrong choice for their situation, and I believe Rust was the right choice. If they were making a logical argument, surely they would have considered Go and in doing so with their presented criteria they would have realized Go was a better option and, at the very least, refined their critera. “Everyone’s talking about Rust.

Read more
